reason: NO_RULE - insufficient evidence or no valid constraint found
notes: Evidence only describes behavior related to SL-BSR and MAC PDU assembly without linking the specific fields from different IEs.

meta.evidence: All triggered SL-BSRs may be cancelled when the SL grant(s) can accommodate all pending data available for transmission. All BSRs triggered prior to MAC PDU assembly shall be cancelled when a MAC PDU is transmitted and this PDU includes an SL-BSR MAC CE which contains buffer status up to (and including) the last event that triggered an SL-BSR prior to the MAC PDU assembly. All triggered SL-BSRs shall be cancelled, and \( s l \)-retx-BSR-Timer and \( s l \) -periodic-BSR-Timer shall be stopped, when RRC configures Sidelink resource allocation mode 2.  NOTE 2: MAC PDU assembly can happen at any point in time between uplink grant reception and actual transmission of the corresponding MAC PDU. SL-BSR and SR can be triggered after the assembly of a MAC PDU which contains an SL-BSR MAC CE, but before the transmission of this MAC PDU. In addition, SL-BSR and SR can be triggered during MAC PDU assembly.

full_api_response.predicate: No inter-IE constraint between schedulingrequestid and periodicbsr-timer based on provided evidence.
full_api_response.notes: Evidence only describes behavior related to SL-BSR and MAC PDU assembly without linking the specific fields from different IEs.
